parameterdescription.para: Number of elements.
Size of each element in bytes.

simplesect.para: Pointer to allocated memory or NULL.

briefdescription.para: Free an item's payload (token ids) and reset its fields.

parameterdescription.para: The item to clear (may be NULL).

briefdescription.para: Thread-safe fetch of the next prompt index to process.

parameterdescription.para: Batcher handle.
Output index in [0, n_prompts).

simplesect.para: 1 if an index was produced; 0 if there is no more work.

briefdescription.para: Enqueue a tokenized item into the ring (blocks if full).

detaileddescription.para: Ownership of it->ids transfers to the ring on success. If the batcher is stopping, the function frees it->ids to avoid leaking the payload.

parameterdescription.para: Batcher handle.
Item to enqueue (copied by value).

briefdescription.para: Producer thread entry: tokenizes prompts in ascending index order.

parameterdescription.para: ie_batcher_t* passed as void*.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char **prompts, size_t n_prompts, size_t microbatch, size_t queue_capacity, unsigned n_workers, ie_batcher_tokenize_fn tokenize_cb, void *user_ctx)
memberdef.name: ie_batcher_create

briefdescription.para: Create a new asynchronous tokenizer batcher.

detaileddescription.para: Spawns up to n_workers threads that prefetch and tokenize prompts into a bounded ring buffer. The consumer should call ie_batcher_get followed by ie_batcher_advance in a loop until the stream is drained.

Defaults:
If microbatch == 0, it is treated as 1.
If queue_capacity == 0, it is treated as max(microbatch, 8).
If n_workers == 0, it is treated as 1.

parameterdescription.para: Array of input UTF-8 prompt strings (not owned; must outlive the batcher).
Number of prompts in prompts.
Maximum items returned per view. Use 0 for default.
Ring capacity in items. Use 0 for default.
Number of tokenizer worker threads. Use 0 for default.
User tokenizer callback (must not be NULL).
Opaque pointer forwarded to tokenize_cb; may be NULL.

simplesect.para: ie_batcher_t* Handle on success, or NULL on allocation/spawn error.

briefdescription.para: Obtain a contiguous slice of ready items without copying.

detaileddescription.para: If no items are ready but production is still in progress, this function blocks until an item is available (or the batcher is stopping).
When this function returns 0, the stream is drained; out_view->done will be set to 1 and out_view->items will be NULL.

parameterdescription.para: Batcher handle (non-NULL).
Output view describing a contiguous span of items.

simplesect.para: int 1 if a non-empty view was produced; 0 if the stream is drained.

briefdescription.para: Release items previously returned by ie_batcher_get.

detaileddescription.para: Frees payloads and advances the ring read pointer, then signals producers that space is available.

parameterdescription.para: Batcher handle (non-NULL).
Number of items to release; must not exceed the last view count.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a batcher, joining workers and freeing all resources.

parameterdescription.para: Batcher handle (may be NULL).

briefdescription.para: Prefetch + tokenization batcher with preserved output order.

detaileddescription.para:
Implementation notes:
The public header declares an opaque type via typedef struct ie_batcher ie_batcher_t;. This file defines that struct as struct ie_batcher { ... } (same tag name), avoiding any conflicting typedefs.
To preserve strict input order == output order and to keep unit tests deterministic, this implementation runs with a single producer worker regardless of the requested n_workers. If you want parallel tokenization later, add an ordered merge stage.
The consumer obtains contiguous slices from a ring buffer up to microbatch items and never across the ring wrap boundary.
